text: I frquently bump into this issue of not being allowed to use sparse right-hand sides when doing `A\B` , therefore having to do `A\convert(Matrix, B)` . It's a bit frustrating as the result can often be sparse regardless. In my opinion it would be better to get a warning in this case, as I think in many cases it could be useful to be able to stick to sparse arithmetic
